Result Library 0.1.3

Package com.leakyabstractions.result

Interface Result<S,​F>

Type Parameters:
S - the type of the success value
F - the type of the failure value
public interface Result<S,​F>
Represents the result of an operation that may have succeeded or failed.

Result is a value-based class that describes one of these two mutually-exclusive fulfillment states:

  • Success: the operation completed entirely and may have produced a success value
  • Failure: the operation could not go through and may have produced a failure value
On the one hand, a result object conveys fulfillment state. On the other hand, it also holds a value produced by the operation. It may be null and its meaning totally depends on the semantics defined by the operation:
  • If the fulfillment state is success, isSuccess() will return true and getSuccess() will return the success value.
  • If the fulfillment state is failure, isFailure() will return true and getFailure() will return the failure value.

Additional methods that depend on fulfillment state are provided, such as orElse() (return an alternative success value if the operation failed) and handle() (execute a block of code if the operation succeeded).

Author:
Guillermo Calvo
See Also:
DefaultResult
API Note:
A variable whose type is Result should never itself be null; it should always point to a Result instance.
Impl Note:
Instances of classes that implement Result:
  • are final and immutable (though may contain references to mutable objects);
  • have implementations of equals, hashCode, and toString which are computed solely from the instance's state and not from its identity or the state of any other object or variable;
  • make no use of identity-sensitive operations such as reference equality (==) between instances, identity hash code of instances, or synchronization on an instances's intrinsic lock;
  • are considered equal solely based on equals(), not based on reference equality (==);
  • do not have accessible constructors, but are instead instantiated through factory methods (such as the ones provided by DefaultResult) which make no commitment as to the identity of returned instances;
  • are freely substitutable when equal, meaning that interchanging any two instances x and y that are equal according to equals() in any computation or method invocation should produce no visible change in behavior.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Result<S,​F> filter​(Predicate<? super S> predicate, Function<? super S,​? extends F> failureMapper)
    Return a new failed result if this is a successful result whose value does not match the provided predicate; otherwise return this result.
    <S2> Result<S2,​F> flatMap​(Function<? super S,​Result<S2,​F>> successFlatMapper)
    Apply the provided Result-bearing mapping Function to the success value and return the produced result if this is a successful result; otherwise return a failed result with the same failure value.
    <S2,​ F2> Result<S2,​F2> flatMap​(Function<? super S,​Result<S2,​F2>> successFlatMapper, Function<? super F,​Result<S2,​F2>> failureFlatMapper)
    Apply the appropriate Result-bearing mapping Function to the success or failure value and return the produced result.
    <F2> Result<S,​F2> flatMapFailure​(Function<? super F,​Result<S,​F2>> failureFlatMapper)
    Apply the provided Result-bearing mapping Function to the failure value and return the produced result if this is a failed result; otherwise return a successful result with the same success value.
    F getFailureOrElseThrow()
    Return the failure value if this is a failed result; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
    Result<S,​F> handle​(Consumer<? super S> successHandler)
    Invoke the provided consumer with the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise do nothing.
    Result<S,​F> handle​(Consumer<? super S> successHandler, Consumer<? super F> failureHandler)
    Invoke one of the provided consumers, depending on the fulfillment status of this result.
    Result<S,​F> handleFailure​(Consumer<? super F> failureHandler)
    Invoke the provided consumer with the failure value if this is a failed result; otherwise do nothing.
    boolean isFailure()
    Return true if this is a failed result; otherwise return false.
    boolean isSuccess()
    Return true if this is a successful result; otherwise return false.
    <S2> Result<S2,​F> map​(Function<? super S,​S2> successMapper)
    Apply the provided mapping Function to the success value if this is a successful result and return a new successful Result with the produced value; otherwise return a failed result with the same failure value.
    <S2,​ F2> Result<S2,​F2> map​(Function<? super S,​S2> successMapper, Function<? super F,​F2> failureMapper)
    Apply the appropriate mapping Function to the success or failure value and return a new Result with the produced value.
    <F2> Result<S,​F2> mapFailure​(Function<? super F,​F2> failureMapper)
    Apply the provided mapping Function to the failure value if this is a failed result and return a new failed Result with the produced value; otherwise return a successful result with the same success value.
    S orElse​(S other)
    Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise return other.
    S orElseMap​(Function<? super F,​? extends S> failureMapper)
    Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise return a value to be created by the provided mapping function.
    S orElseThrow()
    Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
    <E extends Throwable>
    S    		 orElseThrow​(Function<? super F,​E> failureMapper)
    Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise throw an exception to be created by the provided mapping function.

  • Method Details

    • isSuccess

      boolean isSuccess()
      Return true if this is a successful result; otherwise return false.
      Returns:
      true if this is a successful result; otherwise false
      See Also:
      isFailure()

    • isFailure

      boolean isFailure()
      Return true if this is a failed result; otherwise return false.
      Returns:
      true if this is a failed result; otherwise false
      See Also:
      isSuccess()

    • orElse

      S orElse​(S other)
      Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise return other.
      Parameters:
      other - the value to be returned if this is a failed result, may be null
      Returns:
      the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise other
      See Also:
      isSuccess()

    • orElseMap

      S orElseMap​(Function<? super F,​? extends S> failureMapper)
      Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise return a value to be created by the provided mapping function.

      If this is a failed result, the failure value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce an alternative success value.

      Parameters:
      failureMapper - a mapping function which will produce the value to be returned if this is a failed result
      Returns:
      the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise a value to be created by the provided mapping function
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and failureMapper is null
      See Also:
      isSuccess()

    • orElseThrow

      S orElseThrow()
      Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
      Returns:
      the success value if this is a successful result, may be null
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this is a failed result
      See Also:
      isSuccess()

    • orElseThrow

      <E extends Throwable> S orElseThrow​(Function<? super F,​E> failureMapper) throws E extends Throwable
      Return the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise throw an exception to be created by the provided mapping function.

      If this is a failed result, the failure value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce an exception.

      Type Parameters:
      E - Type of the exception to be thrown
      Parameters:
      failureMapper - a mapping function which will produce the exception to be thrown if this is a failed result
      Returns:
      the success value if this is a successful result
      Throws:
      E - if the operation failed
      NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and failureMapper is null
      See Also:
      isSuccess()

    • getFailureOrElseThrow

      F getFailureOrElseThrow()
      Return the failure value if this is a failed result; otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
      Returns:
      the failure value if this is a failed result, may be null
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this is a successful result
      See Also:
      isFailure()

    • handle

      Result<S,​F> handle​(Consumer<? super S> successHandler, Consumer<? super F> failureHandler)
      Invoke one of the provided consumers, depending on the fulfillment status of this result.
      Parameters:
      successHandler - block to be executed if this is a successful result
      failureHandler - block to be executed if this is a failed result
      Returns:
      this result
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successHandler; or if this is a failed result and failureHandler is null

    • handle

      Result<S,​F> handle​(Consumer<? super S> successHandler)
      Invoke the provided consumer with the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise do nothing.
      Parameters:
      successHandler - block to be executed if this is a successful result
      Returns:
      this result
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successHandler is null

    • handleFailure

      Result<S,​F> handleFailure​(Consumer<? super F> failureHandler)
      Invoke the provided consumer with the failure value if this is a failed result; otherwise do nothing.
      Parameters:
      failureHandler - block to be executed if this is a failed result
      Returns:
      this result
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and failureHandler is null

    • filter

      Result<S,​F> filter​(Predicate<? super S> predicate, Function<? super S,​? extends F> failureMapper)
      Return a new failed result if this is a successful result whose value does not match the provided predicate; otherwise return this result.

      If this is a successful result whose value does not match the provided Predicate, the success value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce a failure value to be held by the new failed Result.

      Parameters:
      predicate - a predicate to apply to the success value if this is a successful result
      failureMapper - a mapping function which will produce the value to be held by a new failed result
      Returns:
      a new failed result if this is a successful result whose value does not match the provided predicate; otherwise this result
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result whose value does not match the provided predicate and failureHandler is null

    • map

      <S2,​ F2> Result<S2,​F2> map​(Function<? super S,​S2> successMapper, Function<? super F,​F2> failureMapper)
      Apply the appropriate mapping Function to the success or failure value and return a new Result with the produced value.

      Depending on the fulfillment state, the value will be applied to either one of the provided mapping functions to produce a new value. Then the new Result will be created with the same fulfillment state and the produced value. The types of the new success/failure values may be different from this result's.

      Type Parameters:
      S2 - the type of the new success value
      F2 - the type of the new failure value
      Parameters:
      successMapper - a mapping Function to apply to the success value if this is a successful result
      failureMapper - a mapping Function to apply to the failure value if this is a failed result
      Returns:
      a new Result whose value depends on this result's value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successMapper is null; or if this is a failed result and failureMapper is null

    • map

      <S2> Result<S2,​F> map​(Function<? super S,​S2> successMapper)
      Apply the provided mapping Function to the success value if this is a successful result and return a new successful Result with the produced value; otherwise return a failed result with the same failure value.

      If this is a successful result, the success value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce a new value. Then the new successful Result will be created with the produced value. The type of the new success value may be different from this result's.

      Type Parameters:
      S2 - the type of the new success value
      Parameters:
      successMapper - a mapping Function to apply to the success value if this is a successful result
      Returns:
      a new successful result with a new success value if this is a successful result; otherwise a failed result with the same failure value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successMapper is null

    • mapFailure

      <F2> Result<S,​F2> mapFailure​(Function<? super F,​F2> failureMapper)
      Apply the provided mapping Function to the failure value if this is a failed result and return a new failed Result with the produced value; otherwise return a successful result with the same success value.

      If this is a failed result, the failure value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce a new value. Then the new failed Result will be created with the produced value. The type of the new failure value may be different from this result's.

      Type Parameters:
      F2 - the type of the new failure value
      Parameters:
      failureMapper - a mapping Function to apply to the failure value if this is a failed result
      Returns:
      a new failed result with a new failure value if this is a failed result; otherwise a successful result with the same success value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and failureMapper is null

    • flatMap

      <S2,​ F2> Result<S2,​F2> flatMap​(Function<? super S,​Result<S2,​F2>> successFlatMapper, Function<? super F,​Result<S2,​F2>> failureFlatMapper)
      Apply the appropriate Result-bearing mapping Function to the success or failure value and return the produced result.

      Depending on the fulfillment state, the value will be applied to either one of the provided mapping functions to produce a new Result. The fulfillment state and the types of the new success/failure values may be different from this result's.

      Type Parameters:
      S2 - the type of the new success value
      F2 - the type of the new failure value
      Parameters:
      successFlatMapper - a Function to apply to the success value if this is a successful result; it must produce a new Result
      failureFlatMapper - a Function to apply to the failure value if this is a failed result; it must produce a new Result
      Returns:
      the result of applying a Result-bearing mapping function to this result's value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successFlatMapper is null; or if this is a failed result and failureFlatMapper is null

    • flatMap

      <S2> Result<S2,​F> flatMap​(Function<? super S,​Result<S2,​F>> successFlatMapper)
      Apply the provided Result-bearing mapping Function to the success value and return the produced result if this is a successful result; otherwise return a failed result with the same failure value.

      If this is a successful result, the success value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce a new Result. The fulfillment state and the type of the new success value may be different from this result's.

      Type Parameters:
      S2 - the type of the new success value
      Parameters:
      successFlatMapper - a Function to apply to the success value if this is a successful result; it must produce a new Result
      Returns:
      the result of applying a Result-bearing mapping function the success value if this is a successful result; otherwise a failed result with the same failure value.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a successful result and successFlatMapper is null

    • flatMapFailure

      <F2> Result<S,​F2> flatMapFailure​(Function<? super F,​Result<S,​F2>> failureFlatMapper)
      Apply the provided Result-bearing mapping Function to the failure value and return the produced result if this is a failed result; otherwise return a successful result with the same success value.

      If this is a failed result, the failure value will be applied to the provided mapping Function to produce a new Result. The fulfillment state and the type of the new failure value may be different from this result's.

      Type Parameters:
      F2 - the type of the new failure value
      Parameters:
      failureFlatMapper - a Function to apply to the failure value if this is a failed result; it must produce a new Result
      Returns:
      the result of applying a Result-bearing mapping function to the failure value if this is a failed result; otherwise a successful result with the same failure value.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if this is a failed result and failureFlatMapper is null
